domain_knowledge: This is a longitudinal survey data that does not have a perfect response rate. Addressing & accounting for missing information in longitudinal survey data is critical to ensuring the validity and reliability of the analysis outcomes. Spending and saving behavior can be used as proxies for Time preference of an individual. Incarceration status can also be gauged by studying the place of residence. If it is ‘Jail’, or other facilities of detention, incarceration can be assumed. Test scores and class standings are some of the ways to gauge the academic performance of an individual.

datasets.name: nls_raw.csv
datasets.description: The dataset contains information from National Longitudinal Survey of Youth (NLSY79). It includes information about the Demographics, Family Background, Education, Health, Residential, Financial & Criminal Records of the participants.

raw.name: ID# (range 1-12686) 1979
raw.description: Unique Identifier of the respondent

raw.name: Sample ID, 1979 (interview)
raw.description: Sample Identification Code

raw.name: Age of respondent, 1979
raw.description: Age of respondent in 1979

raw.name: Age of respondent at interview date, 1981
raw.description: Age of respondent in 1981

raw.name: Age of respondent at interview date, 1989
raw.description: Age of respondent in 1989

raw.name: Occupation of adult male in household at age 14, 1979
raw.description: Occupation of the adult male present in the household of the respondent at age 14 in 1979. Variable records the occupation of the father figure of the repondent, values include FARMER AND FARM MANAGERS, PROFESSIONAL,TECHNICAL AND KINDRED etc

raw.name: Highest grade completed by respondent's mother, 1979
raw.description: Highest grade or year of regular school that respondent's mother ever completed till 1979

raw.name: Highest grade completed by respondent's father, 1979
raw.description: Highest grade or year of regular school that respondent's father ever completed till 1979

raw.name: Highest grade completed, 1979
raw.description: Highest grade or year of regular school that respondent have completed and got credit for till 1979

raw.name: Racial/ethnic cohort, 1979
raw.description: Respondent's racial/ethnic cohort, contains one of three values 1:BLACK, 2:HISPANIC, 3:NON-BLACK NON-HISPANIC

raw.name: Sex of respondent, 1979
raw.description: Sex of the respondent, 1:MALE or 2:FEMALE

raw.name: Family size, 1979
raw.description: Family size of the respondent in 1979

raw.name: Ever convicted of an illegal act in adult court before 1980
raw.description: Boolean variable that indicates if the respondent was convicted of an illegal act in adult court other than minor traffic violations before 1980

raw.name: Ever been sentenced in any correctional institution before 1980
raw.description: Boolean variable that indicated if the respondent was sentenced to spend time in a corrections institute, like a jail, prison, or a youth institution like a training school or reform school or not before 1980

raw.name: Height of respondent, 1981
raw.description: Height of the respondent in inches in 1981

raw.name: Height of respondent, 1985
raw.description: Height of the respondent in inches in 1985

raw.name: Weight of respondent, 1981
raw.description: Weight of the respondent in kilograms in 1981

raw.name: Weight of respondent, 1989
raw.description: Weight of the respondent in kilograms in 1989

raw.name: Weight of respondent, 1992
raw.description: Weight of the respondent in kilograms in 1992

raw.name: Rank in class last year attended at this school, 1981
raw.description: Respondent's rank in the class that he attended in school last year (in 1980) (variable recorded in 1981)

raw.name: Number of students in class last year attended at this school, 1981
raw.description: Number of students in the respondent's class for the last year attended this school

raw.name: ASVAB - Arithmetic Reasoning Z Score (rounded), 1981
raw.description: This variable represents the standardized scores of respondents on the Arithmetic Reasoning section of the ASVAB test. It provides a way to compare individuals' performance on this specific aspect of the test within a standardized framework.

raw.name: ASVAB - Word Knowledge Z Score (rounded), 1981
raw.description: This variable represents the standardized scores of respondents on the Word Knowledge section of the ASVAB test, allowing for comparison of individuals' performance on this specific aspect of the test within a standardized framework.

raw.name: ASVAB - Paragraph Comprehension Z Score (rounded), 1981
raw.description: This variable represents the standardized scores of respondents on the Paragraph Comprehension section of the ASVAB test, allowing for comparison of individuals' performance on this specific aspect of the test within a standardized framework.

raw.name: ASVAB - Mathematics Knowledge Z Score (rounded), 1981
raw.description: This variable represents the standardized scores of respondents on the Mathematics Knowledge section of the ASVAB test, facilitating comparison of individuals' performance on this specific aspect of the test within a standardized framework.

raw.name: Type of residence respondent is living in, 1981
raw.description: Type of residence respondent is living in the 1981, contains one of these values 1:ABOARD SHIP, BARRACKS,    2:BACHELOR, OFFICER QUARTERS,    3:DORM, FRATERNITY, SORORITY,    4:HOSPITAL,    5:JAIL,    6:OTHER TEMPORARY QUARTERS,    11:OWN DWELLING UNIT,    12:ON-BASE MIL FAM HOUSING,    13:OFF-BASE MIL FAM HOUSING,    14:ORPHANAGE,    15:RELIGIOUS INSTITUTION,    16:OTHER INDIVIDUAL QUARTERS,    17:PARENTAL,    18:HHI CONDUCTED WITH PARENT,    19:R IN PARENTAL HOUSEHOLD

raw.name: Was more money put into or taken out of R/spouse savings since last interview, 1989
raw.description:
Categorical variable indicating if was more money was put into or taken out of respondent/spouse savings since last interview in 1989.
It contains four values 1:PUT MORE MONEY IN, 2:TOOK MORE MONEY OUT, 3:NO CHANGE, 4:NO SAVINGS

raw.name: Net amount respondent/spouse put into savings since last interview, 1989
raw.description: Net amount of money that respondent/spouse put into their savings since last interview in 1989

raw.name: Net amount respondent/spouse took out of savings since last interview, 1989
raw.description: Net amount of money that respondent/spouse took out of savings since last interview in 1989

main.text: Higher time preference associated with higher BMI for 1989 data.

queries.true_hypothesis: Higher time preference associated with higher BMI for 1989 data.
queries.question: Does increased time preference leads to higher BMI?
